
	# Prime Suspects

The suspect encrypted a message using a suspiciously weak RSA setup. Can you uncover what they were trying to hide?

We've recovered the following:

> n = 102064367305175623005003367803963735992210717721719563218760598878897771063019 e = 65537 c = 66538583650087752653364112099322882026083260207958188191147900019851853145222


## Solucion

- factorizar n y calcular

```
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~]
└─$ python3              
Python 3.13.3 (main, Apr 10 2025, 21:38:51) [GCC 14.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> n = 102064367305175623005003367803963735992210717721719563218760598878897771063019 
>>> e = 65537 
>>> c = 66538583650087752653364112099322882026083260207958188191147900019851853145222
>>> p = 305875545128432734240552595430305723491
>>> q = 333679396508538352589365351078683227609<
  File "<python-input-4>", line 1
    q = 333679396508538352589365351078683227609<
                                                ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax
>>> q = 333679396508538352589365351078683227609
>>> p * q
102064367305175623005003367803963735992210717721719563218760598878897771063019
>>> tn = (p-1) * (q-1)
>>> 
 
>>> d = pow(e, -1, tn)
>>> d
68912953800967717746790347823754448901033369745619340248072579325544404053473
>>> m = pow(c, d, n)
>>> m
475771530942622400836342960890124188807255520125
>>> bytes.fromhex(hex(m)[2:])
b'SVUSCG{sm4ll_pr1m3s}'
>>> 

```
